qas.question: What year did constructrion begin for the Cooper Union Foundation?
Which was built first, the first elevator shaft or the first elevator?
What design did Peter Cooper feel was the most efficient?
The Otis Elevator Company is today a subsidiary of what major corporation?
What title does United Technologies Corporation hold?

answers.text: world's largest manufacturer of vertical transport systems

context: The <a1_0>first elevator shaft<a1_0/> preceded the first elevator by four years. Construction for Peter Cooper's Cooper Union Foundation building in New York began in <a0_0>1853<a0_0/>. An elevator shaft was included in the design, because Cooper was confident that a safe passenger elevator would soon be invented. The shaft was <a2_0>cylindrical<a2_0/> because Cooper thought it was the most efficient design. Later, Otis designed a special elevator for the building. Today the Otis Elevator Company, now a subsidiary of <a3_0>United Technologies Corporation<a3_0/>, is the <a4_0>world's largest manufacturer of vertical transport systems<a4_0/>.
